events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on the morning of March 31st, requesting to file an insurance claim for the damages sustained in the accident.
After review, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the insured car in a collision with another vehicle on a public road.
An insurance claims agent was assigned to manage the auto accident claim and to contact the claimant for further details and documentation.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment email to the customer, confirming that the auto accident claim had been received and was under initial review.
The agent requested additional documents from the claimant including the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and the repair estimate from a certified mechanic.
The claimant uploaded all requested documents through the company portal, including the official accident report, photographs, and mechanic’s repair quote.
The claims investigation team began reviewing the submitted materials to assess fault and verify the extent of damage related to the vehicle collision claim.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault, and the damage assessment matched the documented evidence submitted in support of the auto accident claim.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering all verified repair costs and additional compensation for the vehicle’s downtime during repairs.
The claimant responded positively to the settlement proposal, expressing gratitude for the timely and fair handling of the auto accident insurance claim.
Following customer agreement, the auto accident claim was formally approved, allowing the claims team to proceed with payment disbursement.
The payment for the approved auto damages and associated costs was issued directly to the claimant’s preferred bank account as per the settlement terms.
The auto accident claim file was formally closed after payment issuance, with all documentation archived for future reference.
All records related to the vehicle collision claim were securely archived in the insurance system for compliance and auditing purposes.
